Description.val:
The VIRGINIA Class BLI 0942 provides a wide range of material required to operate, test, support and maintain the viability of VIRGINIA SSN-774 Class Submarines.  There is a significant increase in the request from FY18 to FY19 driven primarily by the final hotel services working group installation on SSN 774.  Additional details are provided below for each effort.

The "Major Shore Spares" component includes rotatable pool and insurance spares.  Propulsor rotatable pool assets support planned maintenance during scheduled availabilities by decreasing equipment turn-around time/availability duration. Rotatable pool program equipment includes the high pressure air compressor, various pump/motor assemblies, radar mast, ventilation fans and thin line towed array components and other components.  There is a significant increase in the profile of this component from FY18 through FY20 in support of additional high speed machining capabilities at the Naval Foundry and Propeller Center (NFPC) in Philadelphia.  This is the VIRGINIA Program Office portion of the propulsor foundry equipment as agreed to by PEO SUB, VIRGINIA Program Office, and COLUMBIA Program Office.

The Test and Evaluation (T&E) component includes upgrading the afloat acoustic system required to conduct TECHEVAL/OPEVAL satisfactorily, efficiently and with minimal risk of equipment failure. Conduct hardware and software development, procurement, maintenance, and operations as required to achieve and maintain submarine acoustic signatures trials program. The resultant capabilities support the Submarine Acoustic Trials Enterprise, which includes the VIRGINIA Class submarine test and evaluation program.  

VIRGINIA Payload Tubes (VPT) and Intermediate and Depot (I&D) Support Equipment funding includes Vertical Launch System (VLS) Peculiar Support Equipment (PSE) for All-Up Round Simulators (AURS)/All-Up Round (AUR) Ballast Cans necessary to conduct TECHEVAL/OPEVAL and provide ballast for ship operation.  

Non-Tactical Data Processing System (NTDPS) funding includes shipboard wireless LAN that provides a ship wide (forward of the reactor compartment) intranet (Non-classified Internet Protocol (IP) Router Network (Unclassified Enclave) (NIPRNET)) that significantly enhances the quality of the work by facilitating electronic correspondence, personnel data management, collaborative services, interactive whiteboard, multi-user chat and access to these sites: Fleet Training Management & Planning System/Navy Training Management & Planning System (FTMPS/NTMPS), Composite Health Care System (CHCS), prescriptions, MYPAY-Defense Finance and Accounting Service (DFAS), Navy Personnel Command (NPC), Bureau of Naval Personnel (BUPERS), email, Fleet Technical Support Center, Atlantic (FTSCLANT), Submarine Maintenance Engineering, Planning and Procurement (SUBMEPP) and Navy Knowledge Online (NKO).

The Hotel Services Working Group (HSWG) cost component provides funding for procurement and installation of materials necessary to modernize VIRGINIA Class Submarine Blocks I & II (774-783) infrastructure (i.e. power, cabling, cooling, and arrangements of the ship for the entire Government Furnished Equipment (GFE)/ Contractor Furnished Equipment (CFE) NPES configuration.  This combination of Hull, Mechanical and Electrical (HM&E) alterations to VIRGINIA Class submarines is collectively referred to as the "Hotel Services" modification.  Hotel Services modernization kit procurement for SSN774 takes place in FY18 and is installed during FY19 DMP.   

Maintenance Planning System funds will be used to help ship programs identify, plan and execute maintenance activities as well as improve efficiently at all levels (performed by ship's force as well as organizational/depot level) by creating a set of tools to provide a robust, disconnected and comprehensive training and maintenance solution delivering dynamic content. This set of tools and the associated ship-to-shore data environment will reduce O&MN funding over time. This will be fielded as part of the Non-Tactical Data Processing System (NTDPS) to VIRGINIA Class submarines.

Additionally, the continuous ship upgrades necessary to maintain class viability of the earlier ships are included in this funding line. This is particularly important for Commercial Off-the-Shelf (COTS) Technology Refreshment and Technology Upgrades for Non-Propulsion Electronic Systems (NPES). The class level of modernization and capability rests on available resources.

[P40A / Auxilliary Equipment]: Auxiliary equipment component includes funding for ladders and ladder storage containers for Sail Racetracks,  Logistics Escape Trunk/Logistics Plug Trunk (LET/LPT) and other equipment such as I&D material, support material for VPT, and storage containers for Center Cell Access Port(CCAP)/All Up Round Volumetric Shape(AURS)/All Up Round Ballast Grade B(AURBb).

[P40A / Non-Tactical Data Processing System]: Provide software and hardware updates, software licenses and technical and logistics support to the Non-Tactical Data Processing System (NTDPS).

Justification.val:
The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $1.195 million to reflect the Department of Navy's effort to support the Office of Management and Budget directed reforms for Efficiency and Effectiveness that include a lean, accountable, more efficient government.

The FY19 request includes an internal shift of funding from the PB18 line 3.5 (HM&E) to the P-40a line 3 (VPT and I&D Support Equipment). This effort is detailed in the following P40A note.

Increase in funding levels from FY18 to FY19 (~$20 million) support the installation of the final Hotel Services modification on SSN 744 (see Description Above).

Name.val: 3) H1RC8 - VPT and I&D Support Equipment
4) H1RC13 TECH INSERTION TECH REFRESH & UPGRADES
4.3) Shipboard Mobile Computing NTDPS (ULAN + SW Enclave + PDOCS + Upgrades)
5) HRC14 SURVIVAL EQUIPMENT FOR SEA RIDERS
5.1) Survival Equipment for Sea Trial Riders

Name.@footnote: The significant increase in the profile from FY18 through FY20 is in support of high speed machining at the Naval Foundry and Propeller Center (NFPC) in Philadelphia to support recapitalization of production capability.  Investment will provide for the procurement and construction of large high speed milling machines with 28-foot table diameters that are required for semi-finish through finish machining and assembly of COLUMBIA and VIRGINIA components including rotors, stators, and ducts.

Name.val: Naval Foundary & Propeller Center - Spare Rotor
Naval Foundary & Propeller Center - High Speed Machine

Description.val:
Procure equipment and materials necessary to support the VIRGINIA Class submarine program.  Materials are as large as rotors and as small as anodes and fasteners.  VIRGINIA Class rotatable pool rotors are removed, refurbished, and placed into a pool. There is no set installation schedule as rotors, once available, are installed on subsequent availabilities. 

There is a significant increase in the profile of this component from FY18 through FY20 in support of additional high speed machining capabilities at the Naval Foundry and Propeller Center (NFPC) in Philadelphia.  FY18 investment will provide for the procurement and construction of SU-21 (large milling machine) with a 28-foot table diameter that is required for semi-finish through finish machining and assembly of COLUMBIA and VIRGINIA components including rotors, stators, and ducts.  FY19 investment will provide for one measuring machine, one blast booth, one 85-ton furnace, and one SU-22 (vertical turning center).  FY20 investment will provide for fully funding production tooling and fixtures and leica trackers/scanners.

Name.@footnote: VA Platform Modernization TI-02 Baseline Upgrade

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: TI-02 Baseline Upgrade

Description.val:
Provide procurement of materials necessary to modernize VIRGINIA Class Submarine Blocks I & II (774-783) infrastructure (i.e. power, cabling, cooling, and arrangements of the ship for the entire Government Furnished Equipment (GFE)/ Contractor Furnished Equipment (CFE) NPES configuration).  This combination of Hull, Mechanical and Electrical (HM&E) alterations to VIRGINIA Class submarines is collectively referred to as the "Hotel Services" modification.  This Hotel Service modification is necessary to accommodate modernization to major combat system alterations (i.e. A-RCI, AN/BYG-1, and ISIS) and are completed concurrently with those major combat system alterations.  TI-02 baseline systems Hotel Services modernizations are completed during Post Shakedown Availability (PSA) for SSN777 and SSN779-783 and during EDSRA or TYCOM Operational Availability (TOA) for SSN774-SSN776 and SSN778.  Block III and follow ships do not require this significant HM&E infrastructure upgrade as the baseline design for those ships accounts for the necessary power, cabling, cooling, etc. required to host upgrades to major combat systems.

Hotel Services modernization kit procurement for SSN778 occurred in FY16 and is being installed during FY17 EDSRA.  Kit procurement for SSN774 takes place in FY18 and will be installed during FY19 DMP. This is the final procurement and installation for HSWG, after which all Blk I and II hulls will have received the upgrade.

Name.val: 1.2.1) Infrastructure Updates (from TI-08 and beyond baseline) - NonOrganic

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: Infrastructure Updates (from TI-08 and beyond baseline)

Description.val: Provide procurement of materials necessary to modernize VIRGINIA Class unique Contractor Furnished Equipment (CFE) to sustain interfaces and technology baseline with the connecting Government Furnished sub-systems contained in the Non-Propulsion Electronics System suite.  These sub-systems include; Portable Ship Control System (PSCS), Total Ship Monitoring System, Circuit D, Ship Control System, Light Weight Wide Aperture Array and Interior Communication System.

ModificationTitle.val: HRC13 - Ship Control System (SCS) Modernization Backfit

Title.val: HRC13 - Ship Control System (SCS) Modernization Backfit

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: Material and Install

Description.val: Procure and install obsolescence redesign for Ship Control System (SCS) on Block I and II.  The material procurement in FY14-17 includes long lead items for four shipsets for backfit (SSN776-SSN779).
